meanings.definition: A lump or mass, especially of something soft or sticky.
meanings.sent1: She picked up a gob of clay to mold into a small figure.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a gob of butter to the sizzling pan.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's hands were covered in colorful gobs of paint after the art class.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered like gobs of cotton candy in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The hiker stumbled upon a gob of jelly hidden under a rock on the trail.

meanings.definition: To spit or cough up phlegm.
meanings.sent1: He discreetly tried to gob out the unpleasant taste from his mouth.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player had to gob before stepping up to bat.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pretended to gob on stage, causing the audience to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The old engine seemed to gob and sputter before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The cat suddenly stopped to gob up a hairball, much to the owner's dismay.

meanings.definition: A large amount or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: There was a gob of people waiting in line for the new movie release.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a gob of ripe apples from the orchard.
meanings.sent3: The student had a gob of homework to finish before the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The singer received a gob of fan mail after her concert.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunter discovered a gob of gold coins buried in the sand.
